      • getEnergy

        protected int getEnergy()

      • walk

        protected final void walk(int direction)
        This is the walk function implements the movement of the critter in the world. It will take a integer ranging from 0 to 7 i. 0 will be East, 1 will be Northeast, 2 will be North, 3 will be Northwest, 4 will be West, 5 will be Southwest, 6 will be South, and 7 will be Southeast. This function will deduct the appropriate walk energy from the critter's energy level. The walk energy cost is determined in the params class of constants
        Parameters:
        direction- - will take a integer to determine the direction of the movement on a x-y plane

      • run

        protected final void run(int direction)
        This method will implement the run movement on the critter. The run movement is two spaces rather than the one space in the walk function. It will take an integer from 0 to 7 to determine the direction it will move by an increment of 2 i. 0 will be East, 1 will be Northeast, 2 will be North, 3 will be Northwest, 4 will be West, 5 will be Southwest, 6 will be South, and 7 will be Southeast This method will also subtract the appropriate amount of energy to for a run movement. The energy cost will be determined by the params class of constants
        Parameters:
        direction - takes an integer ranging from 0 to 7 to move in the corresponding direction

      • reproduce

        protected final void reproduce(Critter offspring,
                               int direction)
        This method is the reproduction function, it will construct a critter and set the location adjacent to the parent critter It will also set the energy level the baby to half of the energy value of the parent The baby will be also added to the list of the babies to be accumulated during the world time step The parent will also lose half of its energy
        Parameters:
        offspring - - will the the critter type and new object passed in doTimeStep of each critter
        direction - - will be the direction integer ranging from 0 to 7 that will be adjacent to the parent critter

      • doTimeStep

        public abstract void doTimeStep()
        Each critter will invoke this method specific to that type of critter during the worldTimeStep

      • fight

        public abstract boolean fight(java.lang.String oponent)
        This method returns the fight decision when return true the critter will decide to fight, if return false the critter is declining to fight. This occurs when there are more than one critter occupying the same space at a given time step invocation.
        Parameters:
        oponent - - is the string representation of the critter's fight opponent
        Returns:
        True to fight, false to decline fight

      • makeCritter

        public static void makeCritter(java.lang.String critter_class_name)
                        throws assignment4.InvalidCritterException
        create and initialize a Critter subclass. critter_class_name must be the unqualified name of a concrete subclass of Critter, if not, an InvalidCritterException must be thrown. (Java weirdness: Exception throwing does not work properly if the parameter has lower-case instead of upper. For example, if craig is supplied instead of Craig, an error is thrown instead of an Exception.)
        Parameters:
        critter_class_name, - is the string representation of the type of critter
        Throws:
        InvalidCritterException, - if the string representation is not valid an exception will be thrown a
        assignment4.InvalidCritterException

      • getInstances

        public static java.util.List<Critter> getInstances(java.lang.String critter_class_name)
                                            throws assignment4.InvalidCritterException
        Gets a list of critters of a specific type.
        Parameters:
        critter_class_name - What kind of Critter is to be listed. Unqualified class name.
        Returns:
        List of Critters- Is the the list of critters that are of a certain type. For example, if Craig is passed the a list of all active Craig object types will be returned
        Throws:
        assignment4.InvalidCritterException - -if the string representation is not valid an exception will be thrown

      • runStats

        public static void runStats(java.util.List<Critter> critters)
        Prints out how many Critters of each type there are on the board. This is the default runStats for all critters if a critter type has its own runStats function it will be called instead
        Parameters:
        critters - List of Critters.- must pass a list of critters it will output on the console the number of each critter type on the board

      • clearWorld

        public static void clearWorld()
        Clear the world of all critters, dead and alive

      • worldTimeStep

        public static void worldTimeStep()
        This method invokes the do time step function for every active critter on the board it also contains the fight logic. The fight logic determines the winner between two critters Occupying the same space if they choose to fight, each critter will randomly generate a number between 0 and their energy lever. The critter with the larger number will win. In the case critter does not choose to fight, it will automatically roll a zero. This method will also account for rest energy, baby list update, addition of algae and remove dead critters at the end

      • displayWorld

        public static void displayWorld()
        Will provide a visual representation of the critter world with each of the critters represented by their a character based on their type example: craig will be represented as C, algae will be represented as A there is a boarder around the world. When critters overlap the space occupied will contain an integer representing the number of critters on the space

      • randPosition

        private static void randPosition(Critter crit)
        This method randomly sets a critters position in the world
        Parameters:
        crit - the critter to set the position of

      • checkOverlap

        private static java.util.List<Critter> checkOverlap(Critter crit1)
        This method is to assist in checking spots for multiple critters
        Parameters:
        crit1 - is the critter whose location that we are comparing the rest of the population's location for every critter with the same location will be added to the list the list will include the passed critter as well
        Returns:
        - a list of critters occupying the same spot as the passed critter.

      • compareLocation

        private static boolean compareLocation(Critter crit1,
                                       Critter crit2)
        this method compares the location of two critters
        Parameters:
        crit1 - is a critter
        crit2 - is a critter
        Returns:
        true if the two critters passed into the the method are occupying the same location and false otherwise
